column4: I just installed LAMP using package manager with no problems... However, apache cannot interpretate .php pages, is there any way to fix it? I've tried sudo /etc/init.d/apache2 restart with no luck
sudo  apt-get install php-cli may help
OK, I installed php5 cli and then restarted the apache2 webserver, but I still can't get my browser to display the php page... :S
thats all i got then. i have to install that to get ktorrent web interface going as it uses php
